title: Donis - 8 Albums - The Main Discography 1998-2007
description:
DONIS is a well-known Lithuanian neofolk/ambient/experimental music project, the central axis of which is a multi-instrumentalist Donatas Bielkauskas. He creates and plays music using authentic and modernized Lithuanian folk as well as electronic instruments; sessional musicians are also invited to cooperate. The project is distinguished for its solid, subtle and mature sound of modern music with Baltic touch. The debut album ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œDeinainaÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ was released in a tape format in 1998, it was followed by a CD ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œBaltos Juodos KlajosÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ (ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œWhite Black WandersÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ , Dangus prod . 2002), the famous work ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œÃƒâ€¦Ã‚Â vilpiaiÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ (ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œWhistlesÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½, 2003), a joint project of DONIS with KÃƒâ€¦Ã‚ÂªLGRINDA ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œSotvarasÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ (Dangus prod.), an ambient album ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œVacuumÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ (Autarkeia, 2004), a post-folklore album ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œBite LingoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ and antic "Alexandreia" (Autarkeia, 2007).
From 1994 until now, DONIS collaborates with various projects: Wejdas, Notanga, KÃƒâ€¦Ã‚Â«lgrinda, etc. Lately, Donatas pays much attention to electronic and experimental music. A wish and potentiality to experiment not only with ambient/folk music reveals itself in a project d.n.s.

*About Donis*

||| Giedrius KupreviÃƒâ€žÃ‚ï¿½ius (composer, dean of the Faculty of Humanities at Kaunas University of Technology):
At these disturbing times of cultural transformation there are people that strive to preserve the cells of fundamental feelings and senses. DonisÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ progression returning to the section of antediluvian cultural mentality is a successful attempt to convey to us the sounds of that section. Donis&#039; ability to play with modern and archaic expression delights and comforts: his albums are an attestation of these abilities.

||| Deinaina
MC, 1998
Released by Donis (mp3; CBR 128 kb/s)

"Deinaina" in Prussian means "morning star". It&#039;s a debut album of the project Donis, which was recorded with the help of Daina Kacerauskaite.


Music here is associated with themes of mythology, nature, death and paganism. Music atmosphere is created mainly on the ground of neofolk, ambient and new age sound features. Compositions are rich in sounds - from synthesizers up to the strangest national instruments.
"Studying at the University of Klaipeda in the Folk Music Chair, I had to get acquainted with a huge number of new for us folk instruments, so choosing them in this album was dictated by my speciality."

||| Sotvaras
DONIS + KULGRINDA
CD, 2003
Released by Dangus (lossles; FLAC+CUEsheet; HQ covers)

The joint project by famous Baltic ritual folk company Kulgrinda and a noble neofolk artist Donis - archaic Winter Solstice chants with profound and subtle musical arrangements. The sacred experience of the time, when the whole world gets restarted by the greatest and most enigmatic primal God. One of His manifestations is named Sotvaras. The new cycle begins with clear refined beauty ambient, followed by various folk instruments, tranquil atmospheric passages and really old pagan chants, carrying the eternal tale about the magic origin of the world. Now you can FEEL it. 8 pieces with nice medieval designs.

Kulgrinda recorded chants in Vilnius, 2003
Recorded in Klaipeda by Donis , 2003.
Sound directors: Donis and McKaras

||| Bite lingo
CD, 2006/01/24
Released by Dangus (lossles; FLAC)

DONIS is one of the most gifted and most interesting projects in the whole Baltic post-folklore scene. "Bite lingoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œ, the recent work of a young composer, Donatas Bielkauskas, will certainly amaze not only the admirers of DONIS music but also those who have never heard of him yet. In ten compositions of the album, profoundness of archaic chants subtly blends with original contemporary music arrangements.

The chants were sung by a professional vocalist Rasa Serra. Pure and intense, gently flowing vocals of this singer from the seaside endues the songs of "Bite lingo" with overpowering beauty, and distinguishes her among other folklore performers. Ancient chants revive seized by majestic and graceful DonisÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“ sound architecture and spellbinding post-folk rhythms. As in previous albums, the music of the project assumes nearly ritualistic sense.

It is the fifth album of DONIS, and it is based on military ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ historical folklore that the author had been interested in for several years. The journey to the space of the Baltic essence starts and finishes with the voices of Klaipeda folklore ensemble KURSIU AINIAI (the leaders are Jolita Vozgirdiene and Deividas Krutkevicius). Atmospheric, psychedelic guitar runs of Jevgenij Sege elevate the sound of the album, and the sounds of kankles and violin folds it in tranquillity and cosiness. Dignity and profoundness of extant heathen chants reveals itself through original modern acoustic aesthetics.

One of the brightest modernized songs "An krantelio akmenelis" was already presented to the audience in the contemporary Baltic music compilation "Amber Tribes", and was also included in a release "The Singing Land: Contemporary Folk Music from Lithuania 2005" representing Lithuanian post-folklore in the international cultural fair MIDEM. The album also contains two electronical remixes of the title track "Bite lingo" created by DonatasÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“ colleagues, famous representatives of experimental music Driezhas and McKaras.
CD "Bite lingo" is released as a deluxe digipack

||| Alexandreia
CD, 2007
Released by Autarkeia (mp3; CBR 192 kb/s)

Donatas Bielkauskas - the man having keen ear, primeval curiosity, solid musical education and exquisite taste, who has released into the world the musical project DONIS (tribute in Prussian) - expands the space of creative quests with every new album until it transgresses this single regular cultural medium - music related with the tradition of Lithuanian ethnos, which he is the expert of. This time the artist has embarked on a new challenging journey, that is, to compose music revealing the unknown spirit of antiquity. His efforts have resulted in Alexandreia album that serves as a deep, pure and dreamy manifest to the ancient times. Tranquil, transparent and persuasive ambient stream prevails in the tracks. The archaic winds of different nations tastefully add to it in some of the tracks. These include hornpipe, bagpipes, mesmerising rhythms of tabor and mystifying bells. Soft and velvety voice of vocalist Alwyda, who has created the key vein of the album, opens the idealised femininity of the antiquity and conveys emotionally-charged world vision of genius Konstantin Kavafi where the Mediterranean past and present, the East and the West, the Greeks and the barbarians meet in the catharsis of profound sadness and wisdom, where the fall of civilisation witnessed in the vanishing cultural heritage is revealed. The Greek poetry recited in an enchanting voice and the ambient melting the words with elemental force embrace the audience who do not even know the archaic language. Alexandreia album will not disappoint the lovers of Dead Can Dance, Kameras 48, Raison DÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢etre music, either.
Info: Autarkeia.org

Poetry: Constantine P. Kavafis (1863ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“1933).
Voice: Alvyda Stepaviciute [Alwyda]
Vocals: Joanne Spiricheva.
Music: Donatas Bielkauskas (programming, sampling, Lithuanian folk wind instruments birbyne and duda (Baltic bagpipe), Lithuanian folk percussion instrument zvanguliai, folk wind instrument of Caucasus region duduki, KORG X5D, electric organ " Vermona " , effects).
Recorded in Klaipeda and Kaunas, in 2006 (JanuaryÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“December).
Design by Lashisha and sandra.ru
Released by Autarkeia [CD, 2007]

4. Troia
